title: How to Adjust Camera Angles in Roblox

methods.name: Adjusting Your View Up and Down

steps.headline: To make your view go closer to the ground (looking more towards the sky), look at your keyboard and find the key called "Page Down" , "PgDn" or something to that effect.
steps.description: It is normally near the "delete", "end", and inert key.

steps.headline: Find the key on your keyboard labeled "Page Up" or "PgUp" to make it go up.
steps.description: It should be above the "Page Down" or the PgDn" key. Pressing this key will result in your camera view going up.

methods.name: Adjusting Your View Left and Right

steps.headline: Press the "."
steps.description: or ">" keys to make your view turn to the left.

steps.headline: Press the "," or the "<" key to make your view turn to the right.
steps.description: Clicking the comma key will turn your view to the right.

steps.headline: If you are on a laptop and do not have a mouse, this method does not apply to you.
steps.description: If you do have a mouse however, just scroll forwards until you enter a first person view.

steps.headline: Move your mouse according to the desired position of your camera view.
steps.description: Scroll back out and your view should be corrected.

text: Adjusting Your View Up and Down To make your view go closer to the ground (looking more towards the sky), look at your keyboard and find the key called "Page Down" , "PgDn" or something to that effect. It is normally near the "delete", "end", and inert key. Find the key on your keyboard labeled "Page Up" or "PgUp" to make it go up. It should be above the "Page Down" or the PgDn" key. Pressing this key will result in your camera view going up. Adjusting Your View Left and Right Press the "." or ">" keys to make your view turn to the left. Press the "," or the "<" key to make your view turn to the right. Clicking the comma key will turn your view to the right. Scrolling Using Your Mouse If you are on a laptop and do not have a mouse, this method does not apply to you. If you do have a mouse however, just scroll forwards until you enter a first person view. Move your mouse according to the desired position of your camera view. Scroll back out and your view should be corrected.
